questions.neutral: Are the lines starting to blur?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Maybe. Depends what you mean.
I spend free time flying FPV drones, nothing fancy.
Assemblies made the airspace tense lately.
Just easier to keep flights short now.
I fly freestyle drones, not much else relaxes me.
Lately, too many new faces in old spots.
Assemblies leak into everything, even empty lots.
People stream court footage on open bands now.
You start feeling watched, even in the goggles.
I fly FPV drones when I can slip away.
Industrial zones used to be quiet, just paint and dust.
After the assemblies, even abandoned yards have eyes.
Someone hijacked my signal last flight—streamed their meeting over it.
Sky feels crowded in a new way.
Guess the city’s rules get rewritten every week now.
I fly FPV drones, like the acro quads—edge of old yards.
Past few weeks, assemblies set up everywhere, even at my favorite spot.
Locals hacked into the FPV bands, streaming court drama over our frequencies.
Usually I tune out the world up there, but not now.
Last time, I recognized neighbors’ voices in my headset.
Had to land early. Sky’s still heavy, like it knows.
Feels like everyone’s got a watcher these days.
FPV drone flying used to be my reset button after work.
My brother taught me, back before he vanished in a BCI audit.
Even the old cableworks are filled with assembly people now—judging each other, streaming it live.
Last week, they hijacked our FPV band with footage of neighbors on trial.
I kept flying anyway. Even with their court noise, sometimes air feels like freedom.
The lines blur, yeah—city rules, personal space, even memories.
People say our hobbies 'expose' us. Maybe they're right. I hide in the static, hoping that's enough.
Funny thing is, flying always showed me who’s still out there, and who’s missing.
hobby_answer: Yeah, swapped in some new props last week.
Test flight got interrupted. Too many people around these days.
Signal interference is an issue now. Crowds at old flying spots.
Assemblies taking over most open zones lately.
Not easy to find quiet air.
Put a new receiver on my quad, clears up some static.
Flew near the cableworks, but too many eyes after the assemblies started.
Lot of spectrum noise now, some from people streaming those street courts.
Had to cut my last session short — didn’t want anyone tracking.
Not sure when it’ll settle, but I keep moving spots.
Yeah, just upgraded my flight controller, makes the quad more stable.
Tried it out last weekend at the old plant.
Crowds from the assemblies have taken over most open spaces.
Signals are getting messy—some assembly streams cross over my bands now.
Used to be quiet, now it’s unpredictable. Lost video feed mid-flight.
Everyone’s tense, watching for trouble. Makes flying less relaxing lately.
I still go, but it’s different.
Did a full rebuild last week, lighter frame, switched out ESCs too.
Flying’s my way to reset—now I hunt for open space that isn’t claimed by an assembly.
Last time, the signal got flooded by locals streaming their street court on my channel.
Saw familiar faces arguing about BCI stuff, right through my goggles.
I used to fly for the focus, now I just hope no one pays attention.
Even the air feels wired lately.
If you knew my real reason for flying, you’d understand.
There’s not much that still clears my head these days.
Built my quad from scraps after my brother disappeared. Flying kept me sane, honestly.
Just finished a new mod—custom camera, locked bands, so no assembly can hijack my feed.
Last weekend, I almost lost it when assembly footage overran the channel. Whole field watched someone’s trial live.
Familiar signals now mean risk—everyone wants eyes everywhere since the referendum mess.
I keep flying to hang onto something that still feels mine.
Used to share flight logs with friends. Now I delete everything after.
If anyone checks my telemetry, it looks boring. I make sure of it.
Always scanning, always a backup line. I can’t risk association now.
Flying’s different. Feels like trust is gone for good, not just in the air.
